title: [$250] Refactor provided component to use useSearchSelector hook and remove unused and duplicated code (Task 7)

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
#### Background Across the application, around 15 components serve the same or very similar functionality: search users. These components use the same source of truth, `OptionListContextProvider,` and use `getValidOptions` to properly filter and sort options with contact. #### Problem Although the functionality of these components is almost the same, their implementation is the same or differs slightly. There is a lot of code duplication, which leads to situations where users experience different behaviours across these functionalities. Working on these components (for example, with performance optimizations) is also problematic for developers, as there are many places that should be checked and updated. For example, when we implemented new parameters in `getValidOptions` there is a need to update all of these components #### Solution To improve code quality and developersâ€™ and users' experience, weâ€™ve implemented the `useSearchSelector` hook, which will be a single place of truth for all components that provide user searching. These components serve: 1. options selection 2. options sorting 3. options filtering 4. phone contacts importing Using that hook will make the user experience more consistent across all components. #### Task 7 ``` ðŸ’¡ This one should be done with extra care as there is more advanced logic inside the component ``` Refactor provided component to use `useSearchSelector` hook and remove unused and duplicated code. Components: 1. `MoneyRequestAttendeeSelector` Important notes: 1. you can use `InviteReportParticipantsPage` as an example of the implementation 2. you should create new const value to use as `context` param: `CONST.SEARCH_SELECTOR.SEARCH_CONTEXT_ATTENDEES` 3. you need to ensure all functionalities are working correctly. Especially: selection, filtering, ordering, and inviting new users 4. After refactoring, we can remove `getAttendees` cc/ @mountiny @sosek108
Upwork Automation - Do Not Edit

  • Upwork Job ID: 1970471013319193514
  • Last Price Increase: 2025-09-23

body:
#### Background Across the application, around 15 components serve the same or very similar functionality: search users. These components use the same source of truth, `OptionListContextProvider,` and use `getValidOptions` to properly filter and sort options with contact. #### Problem Although the functionality of these components is almost the same, their implementation is the same or differs slightly. There is a lot of code duplication, which leads to situations where users experience different behaviours across these functionalities. Working on these components (for example, with performance optimizations) is also problematic for developers, as there are many places that should be checked and updated. For example, when we implemented new parameters in `getValidOptions` there is a need to update all of these components #### Solution To improve code quality and developersâ€™ and users' experience, weâ€™ve implemented the `useSearchSelector` hook, which will be a single place of truth for all components that provide user searching. These components serve: 1. options selection 2. options sorting 3. options filtering 4. phone contacts importing Using that hook will make the user experience more consistent across all components. #### Task 6 Refactor listed components to use `useSearchSelector` hook and remove unused and duplicated code. Components: 1. `AddDelegatePage` 2. `TaskAssigneeSelectorModal` Important notes: 1. you can use `InviteReportParticipantsPage` as an example of the implementation 2. you should use `context` param: `CONST.SEARCH_SELECTOR.SEARCH_CONTEXT_GENERAL` 3. you need to ensure all functionalities are working correctly. Especially: selection, filtering, ordering, and inviting new users cc/ @sosek108 @mountiny

#### Background Across the application, around 15 components serve the same or very similar functionality: search users. These components use the same source of truth, `OptionListContextProvider,` and use `getValidOptions` to properly filter and sort options with contact. #### Problem Although the functionality of these components is almost the same, their implementation is the same or differs slightly. There is a lot of code duplication, which leads to situations where users experience different behaviours across these functionalities. Working on these components (for example, with performance optimizations) is also problematic for developers, as there are many places that should be checked and updated. For example, when we implemented new parameters in `getValidOptions` there is a need to update all of these components #### Solution To improve code quality and developersâ€™ and users' experience, weâ€™ve implemented the `useSearchSelector` hook, which will be a single place of truth for all components that provide user searching. body:
If you havenâ€™t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.16-10 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-858/folder/13177029/41237798/907088833 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+1836@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb / Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace. 1. Open the staging.new.expensify.com website. 2. Open any workspace chat. 3. Create a manual expense. 4. Create a new report, and add a different manual expense. 5. Open the report of the last created expense. 6. Tap on "More" and select "Merge" 7. Select the expense created on step 3. 8. Keep all the details from the expense created on step 3 and finish the merging process. 9. Return to chat. 10. Turn off internet connection. 11. Long tap on the report of the remaining expense. 12. Note that no "Delete Expense" option is visible. 13. Turn on internet connection again. 14. Long tap on the report again. 15. Note that "Delete Expense" option is now available. ## Expected Result: After merging expenses while online, "Delete Expense" option, should be available on context menu on both online and offline mode. ## Actual Result: After merging expenses while online, "Delete Expense" option, is not displayed on context menu while the user is offline. Option is visible in online mode, but everytime that connection is lost, the option disappears. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0dff9074-ee1b-498d-8c42-ab39431ee8a4 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
